descriptions.content: The ablative also marks causal or temporal subordinate clauses, in which case it may be translated by “because,” “after,” or “then,” or simply by “and.” It may also be used to form gerundives (xxlink 29.3.1).  Another ablative marker ལས་ is also used in Literary Tibetan. However, in the spoken language this form is restricted to the use of comparative marker.
